page.title: 07Homme House
page.content: Homme House is situated on the southern side of the village.It has a private path leading from the church to the house,which would have been used by the family when attending church.The house was built in two parts.The first part was built in about 1627 probably by Sir John Kyrle.This part of the house has battlements and a canted oriel window.The later part of the house is Georgian,and has six bays and two storeys.There is a porch of two pairs of Tuscan columns and a contempary canted bay window. Inside is a curved flying staircase and late Jacobian panelling. In the grounds there is an octagonal seventeenth century summer house. The present owner is Vice Admiral Sir Ernle Kyrle Pope,who has been there ten years. The house is private but the grounds are rented out
